newsitem.title: JAPAN: Japan's Arabian Oil rises on crude price gains.
newsitem.headline: Japan's Arabian Oil rises on crude price gains.

text.p: Shares in Arabian Oil Co Ltd were higher in Tuesday afternoon trade, encouraged by higher crude oil prices, brokers said.
At 0452 GMT, the shares were 160 yen higher at 4,980 yen.
Brokers said profits from crude oil production for most Japanese oil companies are offset by refining and sales of oil products.

But in the case of Arabian Oil, which engages mainly in crude oil production from its oil fields in the neutral zone between Saudi Arabia and Kuwait, the company reaps profits from high crude oil prices, they said.
On Monday, November NYMEX light crude closed at $25.92, the highest close since January 1991 during the Gulf War.
